intro: Hieracium circumvelatum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas, reaching heights of up to 40 centimeters. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a white center. It is often found in moist environments and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
